result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:31 PM Defendant Christopher J. Schultz in court by video in custody with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $150 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim N.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have 1 time visit with uniformed officer to obtain personal belongings. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
